Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel for a family trip to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Christine F
Reviews.Content: Noah's Ark Hotel offers very good accommodation for a family. We had a very spacious and nicely decorated room for 4. The hotel is perfectly situated near all the monuments to visit and the tramway station of Sultanahmet. Nice breakfast buffet on the roof terrasse is definitely pleasant. The english speaking staff is very helpful and the manager very nice. We had booked by Internet and the fact that the hotel took immediately contact with us by mail is also quite professionnal and reassuring. Furthermore, the hotel can organize your transfer from and to the airport and that is also a big help. We had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “I FELT AT HOME”
Reviews.Author: antonio f
Reviews.Content: As soon as we arrived the hotel staff made us feel at home. Noahs Family is extremely frendly and highly efficient . The hotel is spotless, at walking distance from the historical sites, and in a clean and safe area. They have arranged for our pick up from and to the airport. They have even figured out my birthday and gave me a surprise party....that is being at home! Not only I higly recommend the hotel I will go back 'HOME' again. BREAKFAST IS ALSO GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location with a great service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Carlos_Pellon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a couple blocks from the main attractions and the service received from the staff was wonderfull they are warm and really commited to service the guests

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: RiyadhRugby
Reviews.Content: Staff of the hotel is wonderfull! Friendly and helpful, you can hardly be closer to the main atttactions

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Petros M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. The hotel is nice and close to everything. The staff was friendly, the hotel and room were clean and nice. The only downside to the hotel was the breakfast was somewhat poor. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Aug 2011”
Reviews.Author: Kantonerro
Reviews.Content: Great location and staff was very helpful. Been to Istanbul many times and this was the best time we have had. I can't believe we spent three days prior to a connection to bodrum and unhear of we took one taxi in three days. Everything was in walking distance, ever taksim if you like walking. Roof breakfast is the best!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Mohammad K
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel with 3 small children, we had a big spacious room, i must say it was really comfortable.Very nice and helpful staff. Cant complaint about anything. Thanks alot Noah's Ark. We would be glad to come back to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, friendly people and we would definitely stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Isk752
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had a great time here. We were only in Istanbul for a few days but fit a lot in because of the great location. Walking distance to all the top sights and experiences. The taxi driver from the airport did have trouble finding but in terms of location that was the only problems. The room was good. Simple but it came at a great price for us. The central location meant eating out was fun and easy. The hotel breakfast was nice too. It had a good Turkish flair to it. Simple, but for two foreigners also exotic. Most importantly the staff seemed to care deeply about us and did what they could to help. In short we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Syed R
Reviews.Content: Hi, Salam Alaikum We stayed at the above hotel ,during our recent holidays, It was a pleasant stay, very near to the blue mosque,we really enjoyed the stay. its very close to all the restaurants and all the sightseeing. The hotel is very friendly, clean, and the staff are very very helpful and hardworking. the only feedback would be to improve you're breakfast. Many Thanks Dr Razvi

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: TopkapiApt
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very nice and near to all the sides. people are very nice and always help when you need. Ali Hasimi the owner is always there and do his best to make you happy stay. We stayed 2 weeks with 11 Yale students group my wife did a summer class and every body was very happy with the stay we will be back this summer again and stay in Hotel Noah's Ark, they also have a great rug shop near by with same name Noah's Ark rug,

Reviews.Title: “A trip to remember”
Reviews.Author: Ausgrl A
Reviews.Content: great clean hotel, staff extremely friendly, I have many phobias about cleanliness but felt comfortable at this hotel, I could even take my socks off in bed!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Shuprova T
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very affordable and a wonderful place for a family to stay in. The rooms are spacious and clean, and the breakfast in the morning is pretty good too. I think the staff played a huge role in making our stay pleasant - they were extremely helpful and kind and made us feel perfectly at home. We went on one of the guided tours offered by the hotel (cruise on the Bosphorous Straits and visit to Dolmabache palace) and it was a great trip. The hotel is also in one of the most convenient locations in old Istanbul and you can easily walk to the blue mosque, topkapi palace and hagia sofia, and there are lots of great restaurants nearby. I would definitely recommend staying at this hotel, and if I ever go back to Istanbul, I know where I'm going =)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: nortair
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and bathroom worked surprisingly well. Breakfast room is lovely. Staff was friendly and helpful. We left one of our phone to room by accident and noticed that at the airport on our way home. I called to hotel and they put our phone to the taxi and we got it happily back after 30min -thank you. Location of the hotel is perfect. Tram line is in 5 minutesâ€™ walk. Nice restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “good for ur money”
Reviews.Author: Yasser A
Reviews.Content: good service helpful staff nice rooms spaces compared to istanbul's standerd in sultan ahmet bed cover are not big enough for two clean hotel the reception hall is really nice and cozy i liked it i alot ,you don't have alot of options in breakfast and it's daily the same in general i recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Family trip, 4 people”
Reviews.Author: Malyyy919
Reviews.Content: The staff was very good and friendly. We booked a family room, but upon arriving at the hotel, they upgraded us to a suite, without any extra charge. The suite is origanaly for 3 people, so they added an extra bed. The extra bed was uncomfortable and squeaky, but the other beds were incredibly comfortable. The size of the room is excellent, and fitted us quite well. You can move freely in the room, and there was plenty of room for our luggage. The room and hotel in general were very clean. As for the breakfast, it was always pleasant to go sit on the roof/terrace. There is an indoors and outdoors seating area. The food was very limited, and was the same every day, but the staff at the kitchen were as kind as the rest of the staff. The reception is small, and there is a laptop with internet access. We didn't get to test out the wifi. When enetering, it seems more like a guest house than a 4 star hotel, but the brochures and maps they offer are excellent. The location is more than excellent. The area around was incredibly beautiful to walk through, and you can walk to the tramway within 2 minutes, and the grand baazar in under 10. The only problem was there was only way to access to the street by car, and hardly anyone comes up there, as to turn your car around is difficult; you will have to walk from the main street to the hotel. Although this is no problem (only 1-2 minute walk) this made the hotel hard to find for the first time. The price we paid was very fair. We definitly recomend this hotel for any type of holiday-goers; from business men, to families.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: Nilgun001
Reviews.Content: We stayed at his hotel in October of 2011. I was traveling with my elderly parents, sister and her two small children, six of us total. We booked the family room and were very satisfied! The room is very comfortable, large and clean. The bathrooms are clean and updated! We travel to Turkey every year and have stayed in numerous hotels in the Sultanahmet area. This is a hotel that we will definetly stay at again. The complimentary breakfast is very good, with a large assortment of foods to please everyone. Not at all like your typical continental breakfast. Assortment of cereals, cheeses, yogurts, fresh fruits and vegetables (tomatoes and cucumbers) of the season, assortment of breads, omelets etc. Plus it's breakfast with a fantastic view!! The hotel is minutes within walking distance of the Grand Bazaar, Sultanahmet and Aya Sofya mosques, restaurants, the Yerebatan cistern etc. Staff is also very professional and helpful. I believe her name was Gonca, a sweet young gal, was very helpful to us as were the other staff. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful experience, and a fair price.”
Reviews.Author: atomicwasteland
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed a few days at the end of our trip to Istanbul and I wished we had stayed here at the beginning as well, instead of the other hotel which we were not impressed by (and which I won't mention here). The hotel employees were very friendly and were extremely helpful. Though we were pretty oriented by the end of our trip, we saw the level of help that the staff gave to newcomers to the city and it was very nice. I highly recommend this hotel and wouldn't consider staying anywhere else. (It is a stone's throw from the area you want to be in -in the old town). The rooms were very nice, and were much better than I had expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: Fred L
Reviews.Content: We visit Istanbul every two years and have tried a number of small hotels in Sultanamet. This new hotel is by far the best. The location is central. The street is quiet. The price is right. The staff is friendly. The breakfast buffet is great. The views from the rooftop terrace restaurant are spectacular. Most interesting to us was the very "hands-on" owner Ali Hashemi who did everything from cook omelettes to clean up leaks from torrential rains. He is constantly improving the hotel and while we were there was overseeing installation of a generator to cope with occasional Sultanamet power outages as well as recaulking some leaky windows himself. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: pjresq
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Istanbul. The Hotel location very good with easy access to all of Sultanahmet. The staff were exceptional, very trust worthy and full of good advice for ways to save costs with taxi. ferries, etc. Also every morning there was a box of chocolates on the front desk for all house guests to share. Well done boys!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel close to main attractions”
Reviews.Author: GILLKEV
Reviews.Content: This hotel was small, but very friendly, the staff were very helpfull with taxi's and tour bookings. The breakfast is served on the roof terrace with brilliant views of the Haghia Sophia and Blue mosque and the food was lovely ( lots of yoghurt, freshfruits,cheese,olives,bread,cakes,fresh coffee etc ) the hotel is only a 5 min walk to the main mosques and tram stops and has a good selection of restaurants near by ( good fish restaurant ) we would definatly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Huge disappointment-stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: crispianP
Reviews.Content: We accepted our agent's booking of this hotel on 9th October 2011 after reading the favourable Trip Advisor reviews. However, we were booked into perhaps the worst room in the hotel. Initially we could hear a thumping noise from a neighbouring printing press, which stopped around 7 PM. In addition, the room was located on the ground floor, directly behind the hotel reception area, from where we could hear every arrival, loud discussions with staff, and finally the noise of packing tape dispensers being used. I have slept in backpackers hotels that were quieter than this. In the end, I walked out at 11.45 pm and booked into a suite at the Agya Sofia Hotel, which was slightly cheaper and quite luxurious. I would strongly warn you to stay away from Noah's Ark Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Sara S
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a visit to Istanbul, and stayed at the Noah's Ark for 6 nights. It was wonderful! My room was comfortable and the location in relation to the Hagia Sophia & Blue Mosque was very convenient. But best of all was the friendly, caring staff. As a female traveling alone, I especially appreciate good service. Hamdi, the young man who greeted me at reception, gave great advice about sightseeing and the neighborhood. When I discovered that I needed to be in Istanbul for one more night than originally planned I was sad to discover that the Noah's Ark was completely booked. But the staff arranged my last night's stay at another hotel in the neighborhood, and even sent a staff member with me to move my luggage. Hamdi also arranged my transportation to the airport, from the other hotel, and telephoned me the night before my departure to reassure me that the reservation had been confirmed. That kind of service and attention to detail is superb!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: mdl413
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly and helpful staff, excellent breakfast buffet in a beautiful setting! Would absolutely recommend this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Simply great”
Reviews.Author: Slawomir W
Reviews.Content: Dear all if You would like to go to Istambul and spend time in exellent hotel with perfect service and short way to the wonderfull turist places You should take Noah's Ark Hotel. We spend there 4 days 22-25.09.2011 and we can recommend that hotel it is simply great.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful small hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Joshua90
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff,rooms and food.Perfect location,a real little treasure

Reviews.Title: “Greathotel”
Reviews.Author: de57
Reviews.Content: To be honest this hotel wasn't our first pick for our stay in Istanbul. However what a treasure Noah's turned out to be. Our room was fabulous, the staff were fantastic, customer service was above and beyond what normally would be expected. The hotel is a stones throw away from all of the sights - and the free Ottoman breakfast on the roof top terrace was superb. A big thanks to Yilmaz and the staff - We will definately stay again when we return to Turkey. Both my self and my partner have no hesitation in recommending Noahs as a top spot to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, great views, clean rooms, hospitable and friendly staff!!”
Reviews.Author: LMC327
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. The location was very central. They have a great view from the roof top terrace. The staff was extremely friendly, in particular the hotel manager, I think his name was yilmez, he and the rest of the staff went above an beyond to make sure I had a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Everything at the Door”
Reviews.Author: BeaMe
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very clean, comfortable, very large rooms and the complimentary breakfast was brilliant. The hotel is less than a 2 min walk to Haigh Sophia, Blue Mosque, tram stop, shops, restaurants, cafes and about 10 mins to the Bazzar and markets. The manager Yilmaz and his staff were very helpful and friendly helping us with sight seeing, directions and tours.

Reviews.Title: “I'd easily recommend Noah's Ark”
Reviews.Author: julia_hiker
Reviews.Content: Pros: locationâ€”canâ€™t be beaten! Short walk to Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, Archeological Museum, Basilica Cistern. Easy walk to Grand Bazaar, Spice Market, Galata Bridge, Galata Tower, University. Lots of restaurants, shopping, supermarkets in area. View from outdoor rooftop terrace excellent, and buffet breakfast had a large spread of cakes, fruits, vegetables, eggs, teas, cookies, meats, olives. Room (suite) was spacious and comfortable. Tv/air conditioning, free wifi. Owners and staff were very friendly and tried hard to help with anything we needed. Offered free transportation from airport. Cons: very thin walls and occasional lack of hot water, bathroom door didnâ€™t open and close easily

Reviews.Title: “Superb terrace and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: LanaSingapore
Reviews.Content: Great location as central but in a quiet back street. The roof top terrace and breakfast were outstanding. Room quite large but no view as looked out at a factory behind. Good staff.

Reviews.Title: “We've already planned our next stay at Noah's Ark.”
Reviews.Author: st329
Reviews.Content: The staff is great and so is breakfast. Many of the most popular attractions are a very easy walk from the hotel and the management was very helpful with maps, etc. for sightseeing. Pretty quiet at night, clean, and a good rooftop view.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Croatia00
Reviews.Content: Noah's Ark is a wonderfull hotel which suits everyone's taste. Everything what is stated at the hotel's web site is true and nothing was exaggerated. Hotel is situated at the very heart of Sultanahmet and is only 2-3 minutes of easy walk to all important sights, like Aja Sofia, Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, Basilica Cistern and Topkapi Palace complex while on the other hand the hotel itself is located in the quite and peacefull street, free of all the rush and croud so you can have a really nice rest and sleep time. We stayed there for one whole week and really felt like at home. The breakfast is served on the hotel's tarace which has a magnificent view on Aja Sofia and even though we were sometimes late, the nice people who work there would not let us go hungry but maked us special breakfast. We would like to say our big thanks to the owner of the hotel, Mr. Ali Hasimi and guys who work at the reception, Mr. Mustafa and Mr. Omer, who helped us with everything and maked sure that nothing was missing and were always at our service. Overall. for the hotel of such price range the service is more than great and we would recommend it to everyone! Once again, big thanks to all the stuff of Noah's Ark hotel and from now on this will be our hotel everytime we visit Istanbul. P.S. See you in Hrvatistan! Marija & Dejan

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: BiG_Ze
Reviews.Content: well, i got the info about this hotel from booking.com and i went and booked it hence the rating was fabulous??!! when i reached there it was like a shock!!!!!! small hotel, over priced, bad smell, unfriendly staff, not clean. when i asked for help o take the bags up. the reply was " sorry you have take them your self" i tried to explain the shortfalls to the manager he started arguing and showing me that am not welcomed. my booking was for 2 nights but i stayed 1 night and payed for 2 nights because i couldn't bare it. totally i won't recommend this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located, super friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Changepo
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about Ali Hasimi and his staff. Friendliest hotel I've ever stayed at and a perfect location for a visit to Istanbul's must-see sights. The breakfast is sublime and the rooftop dining area has a great view of the Aya Sofia and Blue Mosque. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good service, warm and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MahendraNC
Reviews.Content: Ideal location near to all the historic sites. About 200m walk to the metro. 10 mins walking distance to the Grand Bazzar. Lots of choices in restaurants which are reasonably priced nearby. If you are interested in carpets there are lots to see nearby - prices here are for uninformed tourist. We are a family with a 10yr old son and we found the room size adequate. The showers could do with some work. The decor is not what you can describe as splendid - but you really do not visit Istanbul for the hotel's decor. The staff is wonderful - friendly and warm. There are happy to accomodate you anyway they can.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: michaelbreeden456
Reviews.Content: This small comfortable hotel located in a quiet street close to the Aya Sophia and Blue Mosque was just perfect for our short break in Istanbul. Our room was spacious and very clean. Manager Yilmaz and ALL his staff were very welcoming and extremely helpful. We will happily recommend The Noahs Ark to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel,but you can find better.”
Reviews.Author: keeks85
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel reading all the great reviews, only to find it has a few common flaws. We arrived to be told that we have been upgraded to the suite for no extra cost. When we were shown to the room(which is very large) we were quite pleased with it, until about 6.00am when breakfast starts to get prepared and every bumb,skratch,footstep is heard through the paper thin ceiling.I think because we are young they could palm of this room, because i don't think older people would deal with it. Day 2, we woke to a foul smell wafting in through the drain in the bathroom which stuck with us for 4 days. The breakfast is average,and quite a strange mix,yes the views are good. But weak coffee, stale cake and boiled eggs are not your thing avoid it and pop down to one of the local cafes and have a turkish apple tea and baklava or a good latte and a pastry. The staff could be more warming, the manager never greeted us or spoke to us for that matter.Overall it's average but great location to all the attractions. Just do a bit of research before and you will find better deals.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't believe the reviews”
Reviews.Author: Phoenixtom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Noah's Ark recently having read TA reviews and was thoroughly disappointed. Upon arrival we were informed that our room had been double-booked and would we mind staying in a different room for a cheaper price - which we agreed to do. The room we were shown to seemd fine at first but upon staying there we were disappointed with the smell (it was on the ground floor and close to the drainage system which stank), the noise that came through the door and the fact that the shower was not afixed to the wall. We changed rooms for the second and 3rd nights and the experience was better although for the price we could have stayed somewhere much nicer (indeed we did when we returned to Istanbul a week later, the Empress Zoe). the one positive was the breakfast which was good - especially the view.

Reviews.Title: “Really bad value”
Reviews.Author: jdwalker88
Reviews.Content: We chose here because of its location and the fact it had such reviwes of course. We were told we had a suite half price for Â£132 per night instead of Â£264 so expected something good. What we had was an average sized double room and a smallish shower room - no bath - with 3 double beds 2 tables and chairs. There was so much furniture for the room we could not get into both sides of the bed and had to ask (3 times before it was done) for one of the tables and chairs to be moved. I don't believe the price of the room was as first said or that it was worth what we paid!! The furniture was as if it was from IKEA and the shower was clean but shoddy - you had to hold the shower for it to work

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, clean hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: salilmarley
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at Noahs Ark Hotel. The staff are friendly, polite and cater to your every need. Breakfast is included which is also great. The hotel is clean and comfortable. Its in a good location which really helps when exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Homeyspur
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at Noahs Ark Hotel Istanbul. The hotel looked brand new, and was very clean. Can't beat the location, only a couple of minutes walk from Hagia Sophia in the old city - yet in a quiet street with hardly any traffic. The staff was most helpful and very polite. They really made an effort to make our stay as good as possible. Breakfast had a good selection, great coffee, and if you fancy an omelet just ask! The roof terrace was nice, and the free wireless internet connection worked well. As we stayded four nights we got a free airport transfer, which was nice. On the negative side, the rooms (or at least the door to the hallway) could have been better soundproofed. This was not a big problem though, as it's a small hotel with only a few rooms on each floor. All inn all a great hotel and very good value for money. Would certainly stay there again if we go back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Noah's Ark Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: melinsk
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4 night stay at the Noah's Ark Hotel in Istanbul. The hotel was in a fabulous location - close to all the main sights in the Sultanahmet area. Breakfast was very nice (buffet) and served on the top floor with a terrace and view of Hagia Sophia. My husband and I stayed in one room and we also traveled with our friends who had 3 children - the hotel was perfect for both. The owners were very friendly and helpful (which was very much appreciated) to us during our stay. I would stay here again if returning to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place in the Center of Old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Nickkyde
Reviews.Content: We were in Noah's Ark in middle Dec. and stayed 4 nights. Although this was the first time for us being in Istanbul, we were fully satisfied with our choice of hotel and the city for our winter holiday. Hotel was one of the newest ones in the area and the location was perfect in one word. Only two min. walk, we got to the most famous places of the sultanahmet such as blue mosque, st. sophia, topkapi palace etc. The rooms are very spacy and very very clean. The hotel provides daily h.keeping service.. We had the wonderful breakfast each morning up on the roof terrace with the amazing view of the st. sophia. This trip to Istanbul gave us a perfect experience that we will definitely come back someday for sometime. A highly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect hotel from which to explore this fabulous city”
Reviews.Author: NhProfessora
Reviews.Content: We had the real pleasure of staying here for a week just before Christmas. I loved beginning the day on the rooftop terrace with its views of the Aya Sophia, Aya Irene, Topkapi Palace, and in the distance, the Bosporus, and lingering over the delicious breakfast (filter coffee!). Our spacious, super clean, quiet and very comfortable room was a lovely retreat at the end of a day of touring. Owner Ali Bey and manager Yilmaz Doruk were warm, welcoming hosts and most helpful in setting up airport transportation; the entire staff were so kind and attentive to our every need. The free WiFi connection in our room was strong and worked perfectly. And how great to walk out in the morning and be only a few minutes from this incredible city's most important monuments, excellent restaurants (and a Starbuck's for those who can't imagine a day without their favorite morning beverage!) and the tram. Weâ€™ve been to Istanbul a lot and sampled many hotels in the Sultanahmet district. Because of its fine staff, excellent accommodations and service and intimate size, Noah's Ark Hotel is the place to which we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: JLCBerlin
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to use for seeing Istanbul. It is located within easy walking distance from most tourist locations. Restaurants are all around. The tram line is just around the corner. There is nothing not to like. You have a large room with plenty of space, the prices are very reasonable and you get to eat breakfast overlooking the Aya Sophia. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful, and they even did some laundry for friends traveling with us. Everything was clean, new and gleaming. We will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, wonderfully friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Sweetkoshka
Reviews.Content: The short version: this is one of the best hotels I have stayed in, ever (and to give you a perspective on my standards: my wife and I travel more than 100 days a year and together log more than a quarter million air miles annually. We stay in places ranging from top hotels to bargain beds and breakfasts). This small hotel is clean, quiet and convenient, and has a great location, great breakfasts and - more than anything - super-helpful, friendly staff. Noahâ€™s Ark opened in 2010 after the building - which had previously housed a gold-smelting operation - was completely redone. As a result, everything is new. The rooms are tastefully decorated, and our king-sized bed (in room 203, which we really liked) was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in, with a large, super-cozy duvet/comforter. By the way, shower water temperature and pressure were very hot and very strong, respectively. Oh, and there's free wireless Internet in the rooms. Breakfast (included in the price of the room) is served on the roof, which is half outside terrace and half inside room; the terrace has a great view overlooking Aya Sofya. The meal consists of an excellent buffet featuring eggs (boiled, scrambled or omelette), a variety of fresh and dried fruits, cereals, yoghurt, cheeses, breads, olives, jams, honeycomb and various other items. For some reason, the eggs were consistently absolutely delicious; no idea why, but we looked forward to them every morning! So overall, the hotel is very comfortable and has a cosy feeling to it. Itâ€™s also situated in the heart of Sultanahmet, a short stroll from Aya Sofya, the Blue Mosque, TopkapÄ± Palace and other major sights. The Grand Bazaar and Galata are a short walk, or if youâ€™re feeling lazy you can take one of the very frequent trams - the nearest stop is less than two minutesâ€™ walk from the hotel. All of this would be enough to justify a stay at Noahâ€™s Ark. But what makes the place really special is the owner and his staff. The hotel is owned by Ali HaÅŸimi, who also runs a wonderful carpet shop of the same name down the street (if youâ€™re looking to buy carpets in Istanbul, DO go see his store - unlike so many others there, he is honest and his prices are very reasonable, which is why he has deservedly garnered recommendations from many sources, including National Geographic Traveler. Donâ€™t get fleeced elsewhere). Ali is a wonderful guy: courteous in an Old World way, generous and genuinely appreciative of his clientele. We stayed there for ten days in December of 2010 and our return home was short-circuited by a major storm which shut down Londonâ€™s Heathrow airport and other parts of Europe. One day, after we found out that our flight out had been canceled for the second day in a row, we went to head out to the airport to rebook (again), and ran into Ali in the hotel lobby. As soon as we told him what had happened, he insisted on driving us there himself. On another day, he took us to an excellent local restaurant for lunch, and at the end of the meal we discovered that heâ€™d paid for it. This is not exactly what you expect from your average hotel owner. His staff are similarly friendly and helpful; in particular, weâ€™d like to thank Yilmaz, the manager, who was courteous and helpful throughout out ten-day stay. And young Mustafa, who was a delight to chat with, and for whom no request for help was too much trouble. So, all in all, Noahâ€™s Ark was a wonderful experience which added greatly to our enjoyment of one of our favorite cities. Coming back there after a day of sightseeing was almost like coming home - and thatâ€™s rare in a hotel. Donâ€™t miss it. (Final note: when you book, check the rates for Noahâ€™s Ark through venere.com - when we did it, they were slightly cheaper than the hotelâ€™s direct reservation system, and featured a deal that included free transfers to and from Ataturk Airport. If this deal isnâ€™t there, the hotel will arrange for you to be picked up for around 30 Turkish lira (I think that was the price). Travel time from the airport to the hotel by car is 25-40 minutes depending on traffic; but you can also get there for a mere 3.50 Turkish lira (a little over $2 US) by taking the metro to Zetimburnu and then changing to the T1 tram down to Sultanahmet. Itâ€™s very easy to do, though if you have a ton of luggage you may want to take a cab instead).

Reviews.Title: “Great Owner, Great Service, Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: joejoeno8
Reviews.Content: The owner, Ali, is great owner. He and his wife made breakfast and coffee in the morning, a real treat! The rooms are clean and modern. The beds were heavenly. A great place to rest after a long day exploring Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: Minimum01
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location...walking distance to restaurants, museums, Blue Mosque, Turkish baths, Grand Bazaar. Friendly and helpful staff...they'll arrange airport pick-up/drop-off, make reservations and give good advice on buses, tours, baths, etc. Clean and modern...everything is impeccably clean, the lobby is a great place to relax, the breakfast is on the terrace overlooking the city. All for a reasonable price. Cons: none!

Reviews.Title: “A fun boutique hotel in a great location--absolutely worth it!”
Reviews.Author: hoyablue12
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Noah's Ark just after it opened in August 2010 for about 10 days with a group of 15 students beginning a study abroad program in Turkey. Istanbul was our first location, and Ali Bey, the owner of the Noah's Ark, was the perfect host. We couldn't have asked for a nicer or more welcoming owner and staff. The location also could not be better--in the heart of the Sultanahmet district, steps from the Tramvay stop, and an easy walk to the Hippodrome/Aya Sofia/Blue Mosque area. The rooms are fantastic and the daily breakfast on the rooftop is wonderful. An excellent value and upscale enough for the traveler who wants to find great comfort somewhere other than the Four Seasons.
